rules: Rule1: Provided that substance X has been researched, then it follows that it is beneficial to patients.
Rule2: Whenever substance X is withdrawn from market, then device W does not require modification.
Rule3: If substance X passes safety test, then it is beneficial to patients.
Rule4: Under the condition that substance X shows promise, then it is beneficial to patients.
Rule5: Either substance X completes phase II or it enters phase III.
Rule6: If substance X enters phase III, then it shows promise.
Rule7: Whenever substance X generates revenue, then it achieves commercial success.
Rule8: Provided that substance X demonstrates cost effectiveness, then project P attracts investment.
Rule9: Substance X demonstrates cost effectiveness or it faces regulatory hurdles.
Rule10: Under the condition that substance X improves patient outcomes, then it does not achieve commercial success.
Rule11: Provided that it reduces symptoms of disease D, then substance X improves patient outcomes.
Rule12: It reduces symptoms of disease D or it prevents progression of disease D.
Rule13: If study results create confusion, then they provide clarity.
Rule14: Under the condition that study results contain contradictions, then if they create confusion, they do not provide clarity.
Rule15: Study results contain contradictions or they have methodological flaws.
Rule16: Provided that study results need replication, then if they create confusion, they do not provide clarity.
Rule17: If it was approved by the FDA agency, then substance X causes side effects.
Rule18: It was approved by the FDA agency or if it is not the case that if substance X was not researched then it was published on platform Y, then it was tested on animal model Z.
Rule19: Provided that it treats disease D, then if it is not the case that if it was approved by the FDA agency then substance X does not cause side effects, then device W requires monitoring.
Rule20: Substance X shows efficacy or if it is not the case that it is beneficial to patients then it does not exhibit toxicity.
Rule21: If it is not the case that either substance X fails clinical trial or it does not show efficacy, then device W requires modification.
Rule22: Provided that it is not the case that either substance X fails clinical trial or it does not show efficacy, then it is withdrawn from market.
Rule23: If it is not the case that if substance X completes phase II then it passes safety test, then project P receives funding.
Rule24: Whenever it is not the case that if substance X faces regulatory hurdles then it does not generate revenue, then device W undergoes review.
Rule25: If it is not the case that if substance X faces regulatory hurdles then it does not generate revenue, then device W does not undergo review.
Rule26: Provided that it is not the case that if it prevents progression of disease D then substance X improves patient outcomes, then study results create confusion.
Rule27: Under the condition that it is not the case that if study results have methodological flaws then they need replication, then they require peer review.
Rule28: If it is not the case that if study results have methodological flaws then they need replication, then they do not require peer review.
Rule29: Whenever it is not the case that if it was approved by the FDA agency then substance X does not cause side effects, then device W does not require monitoring.
Rule30: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that if substance X completes phase II then it passes safety test then project P does not receive funding, then substance X generates revenue.
Rule31: Under the condition that it is not the case that if substance X was not researched then it was published on platform Y, then it was not tested on animal model Z.
Rule32: Provided that it is not the case that substance X is beneficial to patients, then it exhibits toxicity.
facts: Fact2: It is not the case that substance X fails clinical trial.
Fact3: It is not the case that project P attracts investment.
Fact4: It is not the case that the research was published on platform Y.

question: Substance X is beneficial to patients.
